abstract: Allegheny Technologies is challenging United Steelworkers of America in conflict over wages that could have wide-ranging effects; since Aug 15, it has locked out 2,200 workers at 12 plants in six states in one of biggest work stoppages in years; lockout includes huge new $1.2 billion steel rolling mill in Brackenridge, Pa.
lead_paragraph: Allegheny Technologies is demanding major concessions from the United Steelworkers, and because the union has balked, the workers have been locked out since August.

headline.main: In Pennsylvania, a Steel Mill and Its Workers at a Crossroads

snippet: Allegheny Technologies is demanding major concessions from the United Steelworkers, and because the union has balked, the workers have been locked out since August.
